data.title: Machine Translation of "Order Of 27 April 1994, Which Created An Honorary Consular Office In Each Of The Following Cities In The Dominican Repub..." (Spain)
data.meta_description: Global-Regulation Translation of "Order Of 27 April 1994, Which Created An Honorary Consular Office In Each Of The Following Cities In The Dominican Republic: Higuey, Puerto Plata And Barahona."
data.text:
The considerable increase in the Spanish colony in the Dominican Republic in recent years, the large influx of Spanish tourists, as well as the sharp increase in the presence of Spanish companies in other countries. sectors, they advise the creation of Honorary Consular Offices that will allow for the rapid and effective protection of the Spanish citizens resident and transeunts of that country.

Under the initiative of the Directorate General of the Foreign Service, in accordance with the proposal made by the Ambassador of Spain in Santo Domingo and previous favourable report of the Directorate General for Consular Affairs, Have the right to have:

First. -An Honorary Consular Office is created in each of the following cities: Higuey, Puerto Plata and Barahona, with category of Honorary Consulate and dependent of the Consulate of Spain in Santo Domingo.

Higuey's jurisdiction includes the regions of Altagracia, La Romana, El Seybo and Hato Mayor.

Puerto Plata's jurisdiction includes the provinces of Puerto Plata, Valverde, Maria Trinidad Sanchez, Samana and Sanchez.

Barahona's jurisdiction includes the province of Barahona, Pedernales, Elias Pina, Comendador, San Juan de la Maguana, Bahoruco and Independencia.

Second. -As a result of the creation of the Honorary Consular Office of Puerto Plata, the Honorary Consular Office of Santiago de los Caballeros limits its jurisdiction to Monte Cristi, Dajabon, Santiago Rodríguez, Santiago de los Caballeros Gents, Salcedo, northern zone of the province of Vega, Duarte, Espaillat and the Fantino sector of the province of Sánchez Ramírez.

Third.-The Heads of the Honorary Consular Offices in Higuey, Puerto Plata and Barahona will have, in accordance with Article 9 of the Vienna Convention on Consular Relations of 24 April 1963, a category of Fees.

What I communicate to VV. EE. for its knowledge and effects.

Madrid, April 27, 1994.

SOLANA MADARIAGA

Excms. Mr Deputy Secretary General of Foreign Policy and Ambassador of Spain to Santo Domingo.
